creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: haggard male figure collapsing into the arms of an older, bearded man; another man at L approaches with coat, while another to his R looks on; in background at L, a woman butchers an animal in a trough
marks:
Signature, Inscription, Stamp

numbered in plate monogram in plate, upper right: [HSB]
provenance: Joseph-Guillaume-Jean Camberlyn, The Hague and Brussels (sales in 1865-1867); Adalbert von Lanna, Prague (sales 1909-11); Kennedy Galleries, New York; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: Return of the Prodigal Son
